thread.title: London weather: Snow flurries forecast as cold snap grips the capital
thread.title_full: London weather: Snow flurries forecast as cold snap grips the capital

author: Hatty Collier
title: London weather: Snow flurries forecast as cold snap grips the capital
text:
Thursday 26 January 2017 14:34 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Freezing weather: A cold snap has gripped the capital for more than a week Jeremy Selwyn 
Forecasters warned London could be hit by another flurry of snow as a prolonged cold snap continued to grip the south-east. 
The Met Office said there was another risk of snow for the capital in the early hours of Friday morning. 
Wintry weather has gripped London and the south-east for more than a week with prolonged bouts of freezing fog, plunging temperatures and widespread frost. 
The coldest part of the city overnight was Kenley Airfield, which recorded -2.1C with temperatures expected to reach little above zero during the day. Londoners stunned as snow falls in capital during morning rush hour 
Londoners were surprised by a snow shower on Thursday morning as they made their way to work in the freezing. 
Commuters reported seeing a light flurry of snow fall in parts of the capital including Chingford, Enfield and Ilford. 
Met Office forecaster Emma Sharples said: “Day temperatures are expected to get little above freezing across the region during the daytime on Thursday and overnight we are expecting another widespread frost. Cold weather in London 22/01/2017 Cold weather in London 22/01/2017 1/9 
A deer stands in frost-covered grass in Richmond Park PA 
Walkers in Richmond Park, south west London, PA 
Photographers stand in frost-covered grass to photograph a deer in Richmond Park PA 
A deer stands stands in front of the rising sun in Richmond Park PA 
A deer stands stands in front of the rising sun in Richmond Park PA 
Frost covers grass in Richmond Park PA 
Frost covers boats moored on the River Thames near Richmond PA 8/9 
Cold weather: A frost sunrise over Primrose Hill on Sunday morning as temperatures dropped to -7C PA 
A family takes a selfie in front of a stunning backdrop in Primrose Hill PA 
“Throughout the early hours of tomorrow morning there could be another fresh bout of snow mixed in with patches of rain or drizzle. 
“Temperatures could finally begin to recover tomorrow afternoon. 
“As we head into the weekend, rain will be heading in from the West and we will have quite a different feel.” More about:
